trans-unit.target: StudyLivre offers you the possibility to view, create and share courses. You can also view and share course reports.
The Discover menu offers an overview about the StudyLivre platform.
The answers of the following questions are missing
You have graded this course on
Create an review and share your experience
In order to write a review you have to be signed in

A course report will be generated once you finish a course. The report is based on your answers. The report will be automatically saved at: Basket → My reports. When you are not signed in all your progress will be lost once you close your internet browser
A course report will be generated once you finish the course. The report is based on your answers. The report will be automatically saved at: Basket → My reports.
The course material can be accessed through the following link(s)
This course has no course material.
Search a course or select one from the course basket (Basket → Course basket). Click on the buttons below to learn more about following a course and the course report.
In order to use the course basket you need to be signed in.
No course found in your course basket.
,which is situated below in the right corner, in order to start the course.
There are unanswered questions on this page.
Drag and drop the pages in order to rearrange the page position
Drag and drop in order to rearrange the questions on this page
Enter a question. Next, add answers and mark the correct answer(s).
Invalid link. A valid link should look like this: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=ftLIR5AjqMs, https://youtu.be/ftLIR5AjqMs
The title of the introduction (required field)
No provider (institution or organization) found. This is an optional component.
No instructors found. This is an optional component.
There are no announcements for this course. This component is optional.
Course description of maximum 250 words (required field)
Estimated course duration in minutes (required field)
This course is already published. Keep this in mind when you want to edit this course.

When your course is published it will be available in the search results. A publication cannot be reversed! You can still edit the course once it is published, except the assignment pages. Click on the button below in order to publish your course
This course does not met the minimum requirements. Navigate to the Start Page or click on the link to find out what is missing
Course name will appear here once it is known
In this menu you can create a course. It is recommended to take a look at our guidelines and author rights policy before you start creating courses.
At least one course page is present
What to do when you have met the minimum requirements
When your course meets the minimum requirements you can publish it. After publication the course will be added to the search results. Navigate to the tab
The title of the page (required field)
This course has no name yet
You don’t have created any course yet
There are no reports which are shared with you
There are currently no share requests.

StudyLivre offers you the possibility to view, create and share courses. A course report will be generated once you finish a course. The report is based on your answers. You can share reports with other users. Click on the buttons below for more information.
StudyLivre offers you the possibility create courses. Each course contains multiple pages. You can add or edit the following course pages
Click on the button below to learn more about following a course
for example, a page with announcements, documents or a planning
StudyLivre is an educational platform where you can
Click on the button below to learn more about following a course
Choose what you want to learn
View or share a course report which shows your course results

A course report will be generated once you finish a course. You can view and share the report. A page will be generated for each assignment page (with open-ended and multiple choice questions). You can view the report online or download it as PDF file.
You can share a course report with other people, for example: a friend or a teacher. The only thing you have to do is fill in the SHARE CODE from the person which you want to share with

StudyLivre offers you the possibility to view, create and share courses. A course report will be generated once you finish a course. The report is based on your answers. You can share reports with other users
The Discover menu offers an overview about the StudyLivre platform. Select a subject you want to know more
Send an email to info@studyLivre.com where you indicate that you want to remove your account.
Click on the buttons below for mor information.
Find out what you can do
By visiting and using this site you agree with our
You can view all the questions which belong to this course and the answers you have given
Click on the button below for more information about creating courses.
Once you finish a course the course report which belongs to it will be saved here automatically.
This course has no provider (institution or organization)
What do you want to notify?
Inappropriate content/ content that violates the guidelines
A detailed description of the issue
Click on the button below for more information about course reports.
Are you sure you want to remove this course from the course basket?
You changed this page. Do you want to save the changes?
What will be the title of assignment page
Which kind of explanation do you want to add?
Select an image with a pgn, jpg or jpeg extension
Are you sure you want to remove the provider
Are you sure you want to remove the following instructor:
Are you sure you want to remove the page
Do you wan to remove the following announcement
Are you sure you want to remove this course
Are you sure you want to remove this course
Are you sure you want to remove the selected messages?
Select an image with a pgn, jpg or jpeg extension
When you create an account you agree with our
Sign in with a Facebook or Google account
Sign in with a social media account
When you sign in for the first time with your social media account (Facebook or Google) the following data will be saved automatically
Social media account you used during the first login
From now on you can sign in with your social media account.
Do you want to remove the report which belongs to the course
The share code of the person you want to share with

When you enter a share code of a person he or she can view your report when your share request has been accepted. It might take a while before your request is accepted. When the request is ACCEPTED the block “Shared with” (see illustration) will appear. Note: you cannot remove a report which you have shared.
No providers found for this course
No instructors found for this course
This course has no course card yet
This course is published. Persons who follow this course are allowed to finish the course. The course will no longer appear in the search results.
Are you sure you want to remove the course
This course has no reviews yet.
Are you sure you want to remove the person
? All shared course reports will also be deleted.
Are you sure you want to remove the report from
At least one item should be selected
Sign in to Google drive and select the directory you want to share
Select the hyperlink which appears in the modal and copy it
Past the link on the StudyLivre page Documents and press the button + url

On the page Documents you can find one or two hyper links which point to Google Drive and/or Dropbox. On those sites you can place additional course material, like Word documents, PDF files or PowerPoint presentations.
In order to add course material you need a Google Drive or Dropbox account. Add the material to a PUBLIC DIRECTORY. Next, add the link of the directory on the page Documents
Like course material from a public Google Drive and/or Dropbox directory
Copy the link on the StudyLivre page Documents and press the button + url
Select the hyperlink ‘copy link’ which appears in the modal
Paste the link on the StudyLivre page Documents. Next press the button + url.
The end result which the student sees
Navigate to: Home → Search. On the right side of each search result there are five buttons. The corresponding functionality is as follows
Where can you edit this part
A course contains multiple pages. The division is as follows:
Select a topic where you want to learn more about

The explanation of a topic starts with an introduction paragraph which contains a brief description. Next, a paragraph follows where you can find out how to edit the (course) component. Finally, you see an example of the course component once it is finished
Search data provides input for the search result. This part is required. A course without this part cannot be published
Each course contains a Course Card where you can find a short course overview. This part is required. A course without this part cannot be published.
a brief overview about the course attributes, like instructor, difficulty and the course duration (automatically generated)
It is possible to add a planning scheme for your course on the page Planning. This course part is optional. You can edit this page if you want to
On the page Announcements you can add course related announcements. This course part is optional. You can edit this page if you want to

A explanation page contains video and/or text. You can add as many pages as you want to. When a page is created it will appear in the Page Overview. A course should contain at least one page before it can be published
Option I: Video and text explanation page
Option II: Text only explanation page
Select the button + Video and/or text
Edit the page. Next, click on the button Save
Once the page is saved it will appear in the Page Overview
Edit the page. Next, click on the button Save
Once the page is saved it will appear in the Page Overview

An assignment page consists of open-ended and/or multiple choice questions. The number of questions per page varies from one to ten. At least one correct answer should be checked for each multiple choice question. You can add as many pages as you like. Once a page is created it will appear in the Page Overview.
Select the button + Multiple choice question
Enter an answer indication. Next, click on the button Save
Enter a question and several possible answers. Next, make the correct answer(s) checked. Next, click the button Save
The question appears on the assignment page. The maximum number of questions you can add per page is 10
After the page is saved it will appear in the Page Overview
There are two options to add an YouTube video to a course page
I. Visit YouTube and select a video. Copy the link from the browser address bar
II. Paste the link in the form field. Next, press the button + Video
A. Visit YouTube and select a video. Hoover over the video and press the right mouse button. Next, select the option: “Copy video url”
B.) Paste the link in the form field. Next, press the button + Video
A course can be published once it has met the following requirements :
A published course will be added to the search results
Edit a course after it is published
After a course is published you can still edit, update or remove it
Once a page is created it will appear in the Page Overview. On this location you can select a page you want to edit or remove. You can rearrange the page order by drag and drop
Where to find the Page Overview?

Navigate to: Create course → My courses. Select the course you want to remove. When a course is removed it will no longer appear in the search results. However, the course can still be available for those who have it in their course basket
Where can you remove a course?
View your course result in a report and share it with others

A course report will be generated once you finish a course. The report is based on your answers. You can view and share your reports. For each assignment page a course report page will be generated. You can view the report online or download a PDF version

A student can share a course report with someone else (who also has a StudyLivre account), for example a friend or a teacher. The only thing the student has to do is to fill in the unique SHARE CODE of the person with who he or she wants to share the report

The cover page displays general information such as course name, the student's name and the percentage of correctly answered multiple choice questions. The page layout is structured chronologically. The rest of the report shows questions and the answers the student has given. For each multiple choice question you see the correct answer and the answer the student has given. For each open-end question you see the answer which the student has given and an answer indication
The student follows a course. Once the course is finished a course report will be generated
Find out what the share code is from the person you want to share with
Each StudyLivre account has its own share code. This code can be found at the following locations
Enter the share code of the person you want to share the report with

After a course is finished a course report will be generated. This report will be saved automatically and can be found at the following location: Basket → My reports. Once a student selects a report he or she can press the button Share report. Next, the student enters a share code in the modal which appears. It is possible to share a report with multiple persons.
The person who you want to share with receives a share request
A person receives after his or her share code is entered a share request (Create course → Shared reports). That person can either accept or decline the request
When a person accepts a share request he or she can view the report which belongs to the request (Create course → Shared reports)
The person you shared with views the report
When the person you shared with accepts your request the report will appear in his or her View report list (Basket → Shared reports)
You can view multiple reports from persons who share reports with you. For each individual report you have to accept a share request
You can view multiple reports from a person. For each report you have to either accept or decline the share request
add the course to your course basket
Each search result contains a Course Card where you can find a short course overview. A Course Card contains the following components
introduction video and/or text about the course (required component)
a short overview which shows course attributes, like instructor, level and course duration (automatically generated)
institution or organization which created the course (optional part)
Each course starts with a Start page

Several explanation and/or assignment pages follow after the Start page. An assignment page consists of open-ended and/or multiple choice questions. A explanation page consists of a video and/or text. The number of pages differs for each course
The Course menu dropdown offers access to the following course pages
a page with a hyperlink which points to a cloud provider (where you can download course material)
on this page you can find an overview of all course pages
Note: some courses do not have the following pages: announcements, documents and planning
In order to close the course press the button ‘Close course’. When you are logged in your progress will be saved
On the Last page you can provide feedback about the course. You can fill in a review or rate the course (between one and five stars)
Each course contains multiple pages. The division is as follows
Right above the Course creation menu you find the tab Standard pages. There are five unique pages
input for the search result of each course
a page which contains a link which points to a cloud provider (where you can upload the course material)
You can add as many pages as you like. When a page is created it will appear in the Page Overview
When your course meets the minimum requirements you can publish it. After publication your course will appear in the search results. In other words: students can follow your course
Both in the Course creation menu and the
you can find detailed information with regard to course related topics
When you encounter inappropriate content or a author right infringement you can notify StudyLivre with the notify form
Navigate to the course page for which you want to submit a notification. Next, press the dropdown ** More. Next, select the option notify
The notify form will be reviewed by one of our employees

When the notification is found to be legitimate the user who created the content will receive a notification. The relevant course item might be blocked or deleted. StudyLivre may decide to block the account of the offender or restrict his or her activities on the site
When the notification is found to be illegitimate the person who submitted the notification form will be informed
Click on the button below for more information about how to add documents to a course
Sign in to Dropbox and select the directory you want to share. Next, click the button: Share
Select the hyperlink ‘copy link’ which appears in the modal
Past the link on the StudyLivre page Documents. Next, click the button + url
introduction video and/or text about the course (required part)

StudyLivre is founded in 2016. StudyLivre offers you the possibility to view, create and share courses. A course report will be generated once you finish a course. The report is based on your answers. You can share reports with other users.

StudyLivre respects intellectual property rights and aims to be a platform where those rights are not violated. In this menu you can learn more about our author right policy. You can also find how you can manage your rights on this website.

If you encounter inappropriate content or a copyright infringement you can report this by using the notify form. A copyright notice may only be submitted by the copyright owner or an agent authorized to act on behalf of the owner.

Once a notification of copyright infringement has been filed, the petitioner can change its mind and withdraw the claim. If this is the case then the notification procedure will be cancelled. You can send an email to info@studyLivre.com if you wish to retract a claim.

A defense can be described as a request to restore a course item that has been removed due to an (alleged) infringement. This procedure can only be invoked in cases where the course item was deleted or blocked. Send an email to info@studyLivre.com if you want to submit a defense.

You can receive a warning due to a copyright notification. If this case it is very likely that a course item that you have created has been removed or blocked. When a copyright owner notifies us officially that you are not allowed to use certain content, we are legally obliged to delete the item in question.
An account which has received more than three copyright warnings will be removed. A person with a terminated account is no longer allowed to create a new account.
If you want to contact StudyLivre with regard to copyright issues or inappropriate course content, we recommend you to check out the notification menu.
We ask you to make proper use of this website by adhering to the guidelines. Each course item which is added involves a certain degree of trust. Our guidelines are basically common sense.
Below you will find rules which apply to this site. We would appreciate if you take these rules seriously:

Respect copyright and intellectual property of other people. Try to use only course material that you created yourself or material for which you have been granted permission. Visit the Author Right menu for more information.
StudyLivre is not indented for pornography or sexual explicit course material.
Do not place course material which encourages people to perform dangerous activities or do something that might hurt someone.

You are not allowed to insult people because of their ethnicity, nationality, gender, sexual orientation, political or religious beliefs, medical or physical ailments. Issues such as stalking, threats, harassment, intimidation, invading privacy and inciting others to commit violent acts or to violate the terms of use is not allowed.
Don’t create misleading descriptions or titles with the intention to get more course views. It is not allowed to place undue, unwanted or repetitive content.
How to report a guidelines violation?
When you encounter inappropriate content or a author right infringement you can notify StudyLivre with the notify form.
Can I use StudyLivre for free?
How can I notify StudyLivre when I come across inappropriate content?

You can use the notify form, which can be accessed from the page where you found the inappropriate content. Below each page there is a dropdown called ***more, there you can find a link to the notify form.
Can I create an account when I don't have a Facebook or Google account?
Everybody. It is recommended to read our guidelines before you start to create a course.
Which personal data does StudyLivre save when I create an account?
Email address, first and last name, social medium account you used during your first sign in. You can also add educational details on your profile page.
Your message is successfully send. We aim to respond quickly to each message we receive.
The notification is successfully sent. We aim to respond quickly to your message.

It is not allowed to post shocking course material or material that can be considered sensational or disrespectful. When you use news or documentary videos that contain shocking images make sure that you provide the viewer with the right background information, so that he or she can understand what is happening.

Cookies are small text files that are useful for remembering settings and preferences. Because we use cookies, we make StudyLivre more personal and relevant. Cookies are saved on your computer and can be removed at any time. StudyLivre uses functional and analytical cookies to gain insight into the functioning and effectiveness of its website. Most of the cookies which StudyLivre uses disappear when you close your browser. Adds and social media from third-parties may use cookies in order to collect information.
Cookies allow, among other things, that:
you stay singed in and that you can use our website continuously
you can read or write reviews and that you can view courses
errors can be traced on this website
you can share courses on social media
advertisers can measure how often an add is shown or clicked

With regard to the placement of cookies from third parties we advise you to read the third party statements. The same applies to our advertising parties. These statements may change regularly. StudyLivre has no influence on those statements. Only StudyLivre and authorized third parties have access to the cookie data.

Third parties may use third-party cookies or similar technologies in order to collect information or provide services. They can also identify your device, or your IP address or identifier for advertising (IDFA) collection, which can be used to deliver tailored adds on our website or elsewhere on the Internet.
StudyLivre processes personal information when you use our services and/or because you provide it to us. Below you will find an overview of the personal data that we process:
Social media account which you use to sign in
Special and/or sensitive personal data that we process
StudyLivre processes the following specific and/or sensitive personal information about you

We aim not to collect data about persons younger than 16 years old. Unless we have permission from a parent or guardian. However, we cannot check if a visitor is older than 16. We advise parents to keep an eye on the online activities of their children in order to prevent that data about their children is being collected without parental consent. If you're convinced that we have collected personal information without the consent of a minor, please contact us via info@studyLivre.com, we will remove this information as soon as possible
StudyLivre processes data for the following purposes
StudyLivre analyze your behavior on its website in order to improve our website and to align our range of products and services to your preferences
How long will your data be stored

StudyLivre will retain your personal information no longer than is strictly necessary in order to achieve the purposes for which your data is collected. Our retention period starts from the moment you create an account and ends when you delete your account.

StudyLivre does not sell your personal information to third parties and will provide it only if that is necessary with regard to the implementation of our agreement with you or meet a legal obligation. With regard to companies that process your data on our behalf, we close a processing agreement to provide the same level security and confidentiality of your information.

We work with other companies that help us provide/improve our services, or place adds. With regard to the privacy policy of third parties we refer to the statements that these parties show on their own websites. The same applies to our advertising partners. These statements may change regularly. StudyLivre has no influence on those policies.

StudyLivre uses only technical and functional cookies. We also use analytical cookies that do not infringe your privacy. A cookie is a small text file at that will be stored on your computer, tablet or smart phone. The cookies we use are necessary for the technical operation of the website and ease of use. Cookies ensure that the website is working properly and, for example remember your preferences. We can use this to optimize our website. You can opt out of cookies through your web browser to settings. In addition, you can delete all cookie information in the menu of your browser.
View, modify or remove personal data

You have the right to see your personal information, correct information when wrong or delete it. You can do this yourself using the personal settings for your account. If that is not possible then you can send a request to: info@studyLivre.com. Please enclose a copy of your identification so that we can verify your identity. We ask for an identification document so that we can protect your privacy. StudyLivre will respond as soon as possible to your request, in any case this should be within four weeks. You can also reach us via our website: www.studylivre.com or email: info@studyLivre.com

StudyLivre takes the protection of your data seriously and takes appropriate measures to prevent abuse, loss, unauthorized access, unwanted disclosure and to prevent unauthorized modification. If you have the impression that your data is not properly protected or there is evidence of abuse, please contact our customer service via info@studyLivre.com.

When you access and/or use the information provided on this website you agree to the applicability of the conditions listed below. The website StudyLivre.com, hereinafter will be referred to as "website". You are not allowed to use this website, if you do not accept the terms. StudyLivre may at any time modify the conditions. We encourage you to read everything carefully. It is recommended to print out your own copy of the Terms of Use.
Your legal agreement with StudyLivre consists of: (I) the provisions contained in this document; (II) the Privacy Policy; and (III) the Terms of Use (collectively, the "Terms").
This policy is governed by Dutch law. Disputes arising out of or related to these Terms, the website and/or information will be submitted to a competent court in the Netherlands.

1. Content: text, images, sound, music, videos, audiovisual combinations, interactive features and other materials you can view using the website, which you can access, or you can place on the website.
2. User: Anyone who consults the content, adds content or refers to the content using a (hyper) link to the website.
StudyLivre reserves the right to modify, delete, or stop the website (components) without any notice.

You understand and acknowledge that when you use the website, you may be exposed to content that is factually inaccurate, offensive, indecent or otherwise objectionable to you. You agree that we are not responsible for the content or third-party data or for damages resulting from the use of or reliance on such content or information.
To use StudyLivre, you agree that you have only one StudyLivre account that should be your real name. You agree that you are solely responsible for all activities that occur on your account.
You agree that you provide content or data only if it does not violate the law, Terms of Use or rights of others (for example, intellectual property rights).

All intellectual property rights in the Content which are not posted by you or other users belong to StudyLivre. The common trade and/or service marks of others in the StudyLivre Content concern the trade and/or service marks of their respective owners.

You guarantee that no Content shall be posted on this Website which contains, any copyrighted material from third parties or material resting on which third-party rights (including privacy and/or publicity rights), unless you have a formal license or official permission from the rightful owner, or otherwise are legally entitled to post the material in question on the website.

If we receive indications and/or complaints by other users or we suspect that a particular user is not acting in accordance with the Terms, we can - if we consider it necessary- for safety reasons and to protect our users take action. StudyLivre may for example decide to restrict or exclude an user of the website or specific functions for this user. For example, suspension of an account or deleting course items, ratings, and reviews.
StudyLivre can take preventive action when an user uses the website for unintended usage, for example when a user bullies other users or tries to hack the website.

The user shall not harm the reputation of StudyLivre. This means at least that the StudyLivre is not associated with violence, sex, alcohol, cigarettes, drugs and extreme political views or that the content of StudyLivre is subject to be defamatory or discriminatory statements. It is up to StudyLivre to determine if this is the case.
You agree to do not the following:
Create a false identity on StudyLivre;
Misrepresent your identity, including but not limited to, the use of a pseudonym;
Provide login data to third parties or login while you use an account which is not yours;
Harass, abuse or harm other people;
Send spam or other unwanted messages to others;
Act in an unlawful, libelous, defamatory, obscene, discriminatory or other objectionable manner;
Show or share inappropriate content or other materials (such as nudity, pornography, extreme violence or criminal activity).
Infringe on the rights of others (e.g. unauthorized sharing of copyrighted content or other copyrighted materials).
To violate the property or intellectual rights of StudyLivre;
Place something that contains software viruses, worms or other malicious code;
Evade or remove protections or make it possible for others;
Imply or declare that you are affiliated with or supported by StudyLivre without our official consent;
Sell access to StudyLivre or related data or rent, lease, loan, trade, or (re) sales; data.

The services of StudyLivre are only accessible for minors if they have received authorization from their legal representative or it is customary that a particular child of this age independently carries out the act.

StudyLivre would like to remind visitors of this site to the fact that the Internet is not always a completely reliable provision for the transfer of and access to information and that interruptions, delays and errors can occur. StudyLivre accepts no liability for direct or indirect damages related to a (temporary) inability to access or use this site, or for any delay, through this website.

The fact that we offer services from third partie websites does not mean that the Livre Study recommends the products or services offered by these parties. The use of these services is entirely at the user's own risk.
This policy is governed by Dutch law. Disputes arising out of or related to these Terms, the website and/or information will be submitted to a court in the Netherlands.

NOTE: this text is translated from Dutch to English. Due to translation, some words or sentences can lose their original meaning. Therefore, the Dutch text is leading with regard to juridical/legal interpretation.
An error occurred while processing the page. We apologize for any inconveniences this might have caused.
Or search a course to your liking
Do you have the feeling this page should exist? You can contact us
You have insufficient rights to access this page!
There are multiple reasons why you're seeing this page. For more details read the section below.
The page has recently been removed
An attempt has been made to change certain data (for example changing the url)
The browser session has become corrupt. To fix this, you'll need to restart your browser
Do you think that this error is unwarranted? Please contact us at info@studyLivre.com
The selected course has been removed!
The creator of the course has removed the course. Meaning that you can't access it. Until this remains unchanged, you'll keep seeing this error page.
You have to wait for at least %1 minutes
We do this kind of thing to make sure a bot (a computer program) doesn't create endless courses. We apologize for any inconvenience this might have caused.
You're currently not logged in. For some pages you'll need to login before you can view them. To login click
